page.title: 01Paulerspury and Whittlebury
page.content: The block is mainly farmland (arable and pasture) between 100 and 158 metres above sea level and drained by several streams which feed the River Tove and thence the Great Ouse. The A413 crosses the western end from N to S and passes through the village of Whittlebury (population 500) where a Victorian reading room serves as a village hall. The site of Whittlebury Lodge is now a private housing estate adjacent to which is a deer park of 240 hectares. Lordsfields Farm is of historic interest and has the remains of a moat. In the NE corner of the block lies part of the village of Paulerspury (population 1000) which was home to the Throckmortons in the 16th century. The Sir Henry Royce Memorial Foundation is housed in the village.
